exclusion:
Put the Z-Wave Controller in exclusion mode.

Pressing tamper key three times within 1.5 seconds will enter exclusion mode. Node ID has been excluded.
inclusion:
Put the Z-Wave Controller in inclusion mode.

Pressing tamper key three times within 1.5 seconds will enter inclusion mode.

After successful inclusion, the device will wake to receive the setting command from the Z-Wave Controller in about 20 seconds.
label: PSP02
overview:
Door/Window, motion, temperature and illumination sensor in one device.

Primarily used as Door/Window sensor, it consists of two parts: magnet and a sensor.

  • Very low power consumption.
  • Low battery battery indication.
  • Door/Window status and battery status auto-report.
  • LED indicator.
  • Over-the-air firmware update.
  • Tamper proof protection.

parameters.label: Basic Set Level
parameters.description: Basic command to turn on the light
parameters.overview: Setting the BASIC command value to turn on the light. The 0xFF(-1) means turn on the light. For dimmer equipment 1 to 100 means the light strength.

parameters.label: PIR Sensitivity
parameters.overview: PIR sensitivity settings. 0 means disable the PIR motion. 1 means the lowest sensitivity, 99 means the highest sensitivity. High sensitivity means can detected long distance, but if there is more noise signal in the environment, it will re-trigger too frequently.

parameters.label: Light Threshold
parameters.overview:
Setting the illumination threshold to turn on the light. When the event is triggered and the environment illumination is lower than the threshold, the device will turn on the light. 0 means turn off illumination detection function, and never turn on the light.

  • 1 means darkest.
  • 99 means brightest.
  • 100 means turn off illumination detection function, and always turn on the light.

Notice: In test mode, only the value in 1 to 99 will enable the illumination detection function and update the illumination value.

parameters.label: Operation mode
parameters.description: set test mode if DIP switch in customer mode
parameters.overview:
Bit1: 1 means test mode, 0 means normal mode.

Notice: This bit only effect by the DIP Switch setting to “customer mode”, otherwise it is decided by DIP Switch setting to Test or Normal Mode.

parameters.label: disable the door/window function
parameters.overview: Bit2: Disable the door/window function. (1:Disable, 0:Enable).

parameters.label: temperature unit
parameters.overview: Bit3: temperature scale. 0: Fahrenheit, 1:Celsius

parameters.label: Disable illumination reports
parameters.overview: Bit4: Disable the illumination report after event triggered. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)

parameters.label: Disable temperature reports
parameters.overview: Bit5: Disable the temperature report after event triggered. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)

parameters.label: back key release action
parameters.description: Disable/enable the back key release into test mode
parameters.overview: Bit7: Disable the back key release into test mode. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)

parameters.label: magnetic integration for lighting control
parameters.overview:
Bit0: Disable magnetic integrate illumination to turn ON the lighting nodes in the association group 2.

(1:Disable, 0:Enable)

parameters.label: PIR integration to control lighting
parameters.overview:
Bit1: Disable PIR integrate Illumination to turn ON the lighting nodes in the association group 2.
(1:Disable, 0:Enable)

parameters.label: magetic/pir integration
parameters.overview: Bit2: Disable magnetic integrate PIR to turn ON the lighting nodes in the association group 2. (1:Disable, 0:Enable, default is Disable)

parameters.label: device and lighting in same room
parameters.description: device and lighting in same room
parameters.overview:
Bit3: When Bit2 is 0 (Enable), Are the device and the lighting in the same room? 0: In the same room (Default), 1: In the different room.

Notice: If this bit is 1, it is recommended also set the Bit1 to 1, cause the PIR triggered, doesn’t mean the people in that room.

parameters.label: disable delay to turn off the light
parameters.overview: Bit4: Disable delay 5 seconds to turn off the light, when door/window closed. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)

parameters.label: light off control
parameters.description: disable/enable auto turn off the light
parameters.overview:
Bit5: Disable auto turn off the light, after door/window opened to turn on the light. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)

Notice: If bit2 is zero, this setting is useless. If the configuration No.9 is zero, this setting is useless.

parameters.label: motion off report
parameters.overview:
Bit1: Enable sending motion OFF report. (0:Disable, 1:Enable)

Note: Depends on the Bit4, 0: Report Notification CC, Type: 0x07, Event: 0xFE 1: Sensor Binary Report, Type: 0x0C, Value: 0x00

parameters.label: PIR super-sensitivity
parameters.overview: Bit2: Enable PIR super sensitivity mode. (0:Disable, 1:Enable)

parameters.label: BASIC OFF report
parameters.overview: Bit3: Disable send out BASIC OFF after door closed. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)

parameters.label: door closed report type
parameters.overview: Bit4: Notification Type, 0: Using Notification Report. 1: Using Sensor Binary Report.

parameters.label: multi CC in auto report
parameters.overview: Bit5: Disable Multi CC in auto report. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)

parameters.label: Battery state reports
parameters.overview: Bit6: Disable to report battery state when the device triggered. (1:Disable 0:Enable)

parameters.label: PIR motion re-trigger min interval
parameters.overview:
In normal mode, after the PIR motion detection, setting the re-detect time. 8 seconds per tick, default tick is 3 (24 seconds). Setting the suitable value to prevent sending the trigger signal too frequently. Also can save the battery energy.

Notice: If this value bigger than the configuration setting NO. 9. There is a period after the light turned off and the PIR  start detecting again.

parameters.label: Light on time hysteresis
parameters.description: time to keep the light on without motion
parameters.overview:
After turn on the lighting, setting the delay time to turn off the lighting when the PIR motion is not
detected. 8 seconds per tick, default tick is 4 (32 seconds). 0 means never send turn off light command.

parameters.label: battery level auto-report interval
parameters.overview: The interval time for auto report the battery level. 0 means turn off auto report battery. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by the configuration parameter No.20.

parameters.label: door state report interval
parameters.overview: The interval time for auto reporting the door/window state. 0 means turn off auto report door/window state. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by the configuration parameter No.20.

parameters.label: illumination auto report interval
parameters.overview:
The interval time for auto report the illumination. 0 means turn off auto report illumination. The
default value is 12. The tick time can be set by the configuration parameter No.20.

parameters.label: temperature report interval
parameters.overview: The interval time for a temperature auto report. default=12, 0=no auto-report. Tick duration set by parameter 20.

parameters.label: tick duration
parameters.overview:
The interval time for auto report each tick. Setting this configuration will effect configuration
No.10, No.11, No.12 and No.13.<br/> Caution: Setting to 0 means turn off all auto report function.

parameters.label: temperature differential to report
parameters.overview: The temperature differential to report. 0 means turn off this function. The unit is in Fahrenheit. Enable this function the device will detect every minutes. And when the temperature is over 140 degree Fahrenheit, it will continue report. Enable this functionality will cause some issue please see the detail in the “Temperature Report” section

parameters.label: min illumination differential
parameters.overview: The illumination differential to report. 0 means turn off this function. The unit is percentage. Enable this function the device will detect every minutes. Enable this functionality will cause some issue please see the detail in the “Illumination Report” section.

associations.label: Basic Set target
associations.description: group to send Basic Set light commands to
